info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:10AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Dona Ana County through 145 AM MDT... At 109 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Talavera, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, NMSU Main Campus, Mesquite, Talavera, High Valley, East Mesa, Dripping Springs, Soledad Canyon and Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 144 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
